DOC.brief_title: Stress Coping Strategy Perceived Stress Levels Performance During Simulated Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Cardiopulmonary resuscitation ( CPR ) cause significant stress , may cause deficiency attention increase distractibility . This may lead misjudgements priority delay CPR performance , may increase mental stress ( vicious cycle ) . Aim : This study assess impact task-focusing strategy perceive stress level performance simulate CPR scenario . Methods : This prospective , randomized-controlled trial Setting : Simulator-center University Hospital Basel , Switzerland . Participants : A total 124 volunteer medical student Intervention : Randomization receive 10 minute instruction cope stress loudly pose two task-focusing question ( `` patient 's condition ? `` , `` immediate action need ? '' ) feeling overwhelmed stress ( intervention group ) control group . Outcome measure : The primary outcome perceive level stress feeling overwhelm ( stress/overload ) ; secondary outcome hands-on time , time start CPR number leadership statement .
